result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob C. Lootans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
31 days sentence credit if revoked from probation.
16CF310 and 16CF484 and un-charged CTC violation are dismissed and read-in.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
No contact, directly or indirectly, with E.H. or C.H.

Undergo and successfully complete any and all programming per agent.
Provide DNA sample and pay fee.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed pending successful compliance/completion of probation.
Huber to be determined if stay is lifted.

records.addlTxt: Dated 12-1-16 from Probation/Parole Agent Cheri Erdman to Court requesting lift of stay on conditional jail time.

Lifting Stay on Conditional Jail Time
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED: 
1) Defendant is ordered to spend 45 days of the 90 days of conditional jail time originally imposed, effective 12-26-16.
2) Defendant shall report to the Eau Claire County Jail and specifically to the Huber Center, on or before 3:00 pm on 12-26-16 to begin conditional jail time.
3) Defendant is entitled to exercise any and all Huber privileges to which he might be entitled under the terms of the statute.
